title: Legit complaints from a frequent shopper
review:
I really hope NTUC succeeds in its foray into the digital space so hear me out here. 

1. Bad UX

- i can search when I‚Äôm not signed in, and when I want to add to my cart I have to sign in which is fair. But when I do, the stuff that I saw that was available is suddenly unavailable. For example, Pampers Premium Care.

- search results are not sorted according to type or relevance! Which is the bare minimum of an e-commerce app. For example, when I search for rice noodles, the first five results are rice noodles or noodles then a trickle of irrelevant products then rice noodles appearing then irrelevant products then rice noodles etc. Why??

- some search results are not relevant! when I search for ‚Äúrice noodles‚Äù I am shown tomato paste, olive oil, canola oil, virgin coconut oil, mustard dressing etc. Why???

- after search results are displayed I have to scroll upwards manually to view starting from top to bottom. Why doesn‚Äôt it display from the top results?

- can you please place all the unavailable items towards the bottom of the search results instead of weaving them intermittently within the available items?

2. Bad fulfilment

The delivery service is really superb. On time, and within the same day of ordering even. However, I refrain from ordering fresh items like chicken or vegetables after a couple times bad experience where I was allocated stale chicken and very old vegetables. To be fair, Sheng Siong and RedMart both do poorly on this category. So should NTUC treat this gap as a major opportunity to outshine your competitors?

3. Bad inventory management

About 50% of the time, my confirmed orders are updated to exclude a couple of items that are not available.

100% of the time, many items that I want to buy aren‚Äôt available. I‚Äôm hard pressed to fill my cart of items worth $79 because so many items are unavailable!
